Articles.Content:
All right here's my TacExo suit, hot off the assembly lines! Uh, although I know the Vulcan isn't allowed on space fighters, I would like an exception, because it has very little ammo, and also it takes a while to shred anything other than very small carrier based ships. So, yeah.

http://i.imgur.com/S0z1gkp.jpg

Stats :

dV - 1,037 m/s

20 mm - 650

Rockets - 19

Download : https://www.dropbox.com/s/1jpe7zwnb7gbyz7/FTC%20TacExo%20Mk%2017.craft?dl=0

I can give you one really good reason why that Vulcan is a bad idea:

Recoil

Edited January 13, 2015 by datubaman

I can give you one really good reason why that Vulcan is a bad idea:

Recoil

I can give you one really good reason that recoil doesn't affect it. Big Battery + ASAS.

Edited January 14, 2015 by Red, the Engineer
Grammar

I can give you one really good reason that recoil doesn't affect it. Big Battery + ASAS.

Well, yes. But, there's only so much that ASAS can do and that Vulcan has a lot of recoil. Have you tested it in space yet? If you have and know for certain that it does work then that's fair and good, and the shame is on me.

Well, yes. But, there's only so much that ASAS can do and that Vulcan has a lot of recoil. Have you tested it in space yet? If you have and know for certain that it does work then that's fair and good, and the shame is on me.

I'm not denying that the recoil does affect it, but it's main purpose is to function as a mainline skirmisher. So it should never fire long enough to where the recoil affects it so much to majorly alter it's course. Unlike bigger vessels, where they move and fire from a static position, the TacExo is designed to never stay in one place for very long, and fire on the move, in the hopes that central thrust will assist the ASAS in dampening recoil.

I'm not denying that the recoil does affect it, but it's main purpose is to function as a mainline skirmisher. So it should never fire long enough to where the recoil affects it so much to majorly alter it's course. Unlike bigger vessels, where they move and fire from a static position, the TacExo is designed to never stay in one place for very long, and fire on the move, in the hopes that central thrust will assist the ASAS in dampening recoil.

Ok, if you say so. By the way, that name has too many letters in it. You should remove the "Ex" and just call it the "Taco". Much better name!

Also, possible incoming doublepost!

Edited January 15, 2015 by datubaman
ok so i was planing on submiting a company but im not sure how to put the CRAFT files up for download or how to put up the images, i was hopeing someone could help me figure out how to. thanks.

ok so i was planing on submiting a company but im not sure how to put the CRAFT files up for download or how to put up the images, i was hopeing someone could help me figure out how to. thanks.

Imgur for the images as it allows the embedding of albums like the rest of us. http://imgur.com/

Either Dropbox or Mediafire for the files. Mediafire lets you track the number of downloads and modify .crafts but has ads, otherwise they are almost identical.

Hey everyone! I just created a forum account here and I would like to say hello! Hat bat you may of noticed that I have sent you an Email about a jet submission for this series (if you haven't go check your email). Anways here is my two other submissions

Name: Dawnstar

Class: Capital ship (I would like to consider it a battleship or a battle cruiser)

Lore: This ship was created by HKA's top engineers as a response to the destruction of the KSP. So their engineers and scientists had to create a smaller and cheaper battleship quickly to use against GMI forces, it may not seem much compared to other capital ships but with the right weapons it could pack a punch

Notes: Yes I did launch this using infinite fuel but hatbat, you made and launched larger ships than this one before so I guarantee that with an efficient launch system (and perhaps a few tweaks to the design) you shouldn't have much of a problem launching this ship. Also the rcs controls on the missiles got wacked up, so use "N" (backwards) instead of "H" (forwards) that might also be the same with the left and right controls, also the missiles might be too weak.

Manufacturer: HKA

http://imgur.com/a/dRPh5

Name: Star rider

Class: Fighter (Would like to consider it a light fighter)

Lore: After watching the teaser for the upcoming movie "Kerbal wars: The force awakens" Rubin Kerman; one of HKA's top engineers looked at the X-wing fighters in the teaser and said "You know what, I could probably make that" and this is what we got in the end.

Notes: I didn't intend it on looking like an X-wing fighter from starwars but thats how it turned

Manufacturer: HKA

out in the end .

http://imgur.com/a/q2QFB

Name Claymore

Class: Fighter

Lore: Sorry I don't have lore for this one, all I can say is that it can belong to either manufacture (HKA or GMI I don't mind which one you pick) and that it looks cool

Notes: Mechjeb and Launch system not included (batteries are also not included)

Manufacturer: Read the "Lore"

http://imgur.com/a/E9D5a

- - - Updated - - -

Oh and I forgot the ship downloads!

https://www./?cbdyjfm3ah1bbaz (dawnstar)

http://www./download/p4cp72n5qfvriv5/Star+Rider+Fighter.craft (star rider)

https://www./?gdqrgrvv4oyam15 (Claymore)

Edited January 24, 2015 by Halokid

Introducing...

Union Dynamics

Complete Download for all Union Dynamics Assets: Here

Table of Contents

I. Info

II. Ground Support Units

III. Logistics

IV. Space Fighters

V. Kethane

VI. Munitions

VII. Capital Ships

VIII. Miscellaneous

I. Info

Status: COMPANY

Allegiance: HKA*

Bio: In the wake of the GMI attack on Kerbal Space Center, Union Dyamics, then a major manufacturer of electronic bottle openers, saw an opportunity and decided to enter into the defense industry. We seek to prove ourselves as a leading manufacturer of military vehicles and equipment. And we believe that HKA can help us achieve that goal.

II. Ground Support

Complete Download for all Ground Support Units: Here

Armored Vehicles NOTICE: ARMORED UNITS MUST USE LEGACY AIMING WITH BDA VERSION 0.9.0+

The Armored Vehicles presented before you are the best that our engineers at Union Dynamics have produced. I assure you, you will not find any group of vehicles that are as hard to kill as these. Part of their secret is the use of the EVA command chairs instead of a capsule. This allows for smaller, leaner, and more rugged construction than would otherwise be allowed. They all come equipped with KAS functionality, Short-Range and Long-Range Communications Capabilities, and Mechjeb.

Complete Download for all Armored Vehicles: Here

Artillery

Here comes the Artillery! Whether supporting an advance or keeping the enemy at bay, these units will keep the enemy hell at your command. Keep in mind though, none of these units are capable of moving on their own, so a vehicle with towing capabilities is needed to move them.

Crew: 2

More in development...

III. Logistics

Kerbin-Based

These units are for meant solely for use on Kerbin. They are unable to transport anything anywhere outside of that. But they get the job done quick and easy.

C-1 Skylifter Retired

"Fly in style!"

Classification: Short-Range Personnel Transport

Parts: 47

Mass: 15.7t

Size (H/W/L): 4.4m/15.8m/13.6m

Cargo Capacity: N/A

Passenger Capacity: 8

Crew: 2

Download: LINK

"All aboard!"

Parts: 135

Mass: 78.8t

Size (H/W/L): 11.3m/33.6m/30.0m

Cargo Capacity: N/A

Passenger Capacity: 48

Crew: 4

Download: LINK

"Who said that tanks can't fly?"

Mass: 76.8t

Cargo Capacity: x1 M10A1 Yellowstone, or an object of equivalent mass.

Passenger Capacity: N/A

Shuttles

These units are for transporting men and material to and from Kerbin Orbit. Some can even go beyond that.

"We'll get it there, and back too!"

Classification: Semi-reusable Satellite Placement, Maintenance, and Retrieval Spaceplane

Max dV: 2109 m/s

Propulsion: x2 LV-909 Liquid Fuel Engines

Cargo Capacity: 1 Satellite, plus x2 KAS Type B Containers

Passenger Capacity: 4

Crew: 2

Download:

More in development...

IV. Space Fighters

Carrier-Based

These are space fighters designed to operate off of carriers. They have no atmospheric capabilities whatsoever, and what they do have is mainly there for emergencies. Nonetheless, they are very effective in their element.

FX-1 Kitsune OUT OF DATE

"A superb machine!"

Classification: Short-range Carrier-based fighter

Parts: 69

Mass: 10.1t

Size (H/W/L): 4.2m/3.2m/1.9m

Max dV: 1882 m/s

Propulsion: x6 O-10 Monopropellant Engines

Armament: x1 Fixed Twin .50cal MGs, x2 Hydra-70 Rocket Pods

Crew: Crew Number (&roles)

Download:

More in development...

V. Kethane

Satellites

Satellites for detecting Kethane. What? Were you expecting something different?

KDS-1 OUT OF DATE

"I'll sniff it out!"

Classification: Small-size, Cargo-deployed Kethane Detector Satellite

Parts: 29

Mass: 1.9t

Size (H/W/L): 2.0m/1.3m/1.0m

Sensor: KE-S210

Deployment Method: Cargo (CS-1 Kalvin)

Download (goes in subassemblies): https://www.dropbox.com/s/c999r0tkhnnpo7w/KDS-1.craft?dl=0

More in development...

Acceleration Time: Approx. 3.5 seconds

More in development...

VII. Capital Ships

Currently Under Development

VIII. Miscellaneous

Trainer Aircraft

"All great pilots start somewhere."

Classification: Beginner Training Aircraft

Parts: 32

Mass: 8.3t

Size (H/W/L): 4.2m/11.9m/11.9m

Crew: 2 (1 Instructor, 1 Trainee)

Download: LINK

More Coming Soon...

*Although we have aligned ourselves with HKA, we have been getting reports that UD assets are being employed by GMI. An internal investigation is currently underway as to how GMI managed to acquire any of our units, as none have been sold or surrendered to them. We have no further details at this time.

*UPDATE* 2/9/15- Current investigation leads us to conclude that a member of the administrative level may be selling UD Assets to GMI under the table. We are uncertain as to whom it may be at this time or how many UD Assets have been sold. More details will be released as they come up.

P.S.- How do I spoiler? I would like to spoiler this so I can reduce the size of this post, but still keep the formatting.

Bonus: Can anyone guess at the naming scheme that I've used for my armored vehicles?

S.O.C.S. (Strategic Orbital Combat Systems) Though they don't really live up to there name, they have produced some great quality land and air craft, but sometimes they cant be trusted, as they are known to switch loyalties every once and a wile, they not only are there own corporation they also sell some types of vehicles, but they have there secrets as well, they work for the highest bidder, but if you mess with them in any way they WILL lash out to the best of there ability. At the outbreak of war they rushed to create there 1st Gen. of orbital craft. Some say they have more then they let on. others say they are a myth in terms of combat. Whatever the case they are a force to be reckoned with(need help with logo)

DOWNLOADS

Okay, so I decided to try my hand at this, although I know there have been many great submissions.

I am submitting this craft as an independent engineer, and so I will allow for it to be used in whatever way you see fit.

I present to you the Kratos Class Destroyer (or frigate or whatever the classification really is):

https://www.dropbox.com/s/u6pucx4437kppm9/Kratos%20Class%20Destroyer%20v2%20%28LC%29%20Launcher.craft?dl=0

Specs:

- Under 400 parts fully loaded*

- 2.5-3km/s delta-v (enough to reach duna orbit from LKO)**

- Unsure of TWR, but varies depending on engine selection**

- 1-2 kerbonauts

- Hybrid armor for a beautiful exterior (up to 3 layers in some places)!

- Full launch system included!

Armament:

- 8 mini torpedoes***

- 4 small missiles

- 1 Large Cluster Missile**** (this is a very unique weapon, see notes on how to operate)

Javascript is disabled. View full album

(The large missile pictured in this album is not the large cluster missile. It is a faster... much much faster, but less controllable, missile dubbed the "Falcon Punch" designed to punch through multiple layers of armor. Available upon request .)

Notes:

*"Fully loaded includes all weapons, including the relatively parts-heavy large cluster missile. Under 300 parts when unloaded, under 500 with included launch system!

**Press 1 to toggle the Aerospike. Press 2 to toggle the two Atomic Engines. Delta-v based on using only nuclear propulsion.

***Stage once to activate, stage a second time to fire. Do this in quick succession. A small explosion may occur in the chamber - this is nothing to worry about.

****WARNING: When large cluster missile is on board, it is crucial to remember not to stage past the 4th small missile (the next stage will activate the cluster even if it is docked inside the Kratos!!!).

Instructions: Undock missile and use the docking keys (i,j,k,l,h,n) to maneuver the missile out of the Kratos. Set target and pursue. Achieve a relative velocity of at least 100m/s to target. When 200-500m away from target, stage the missle. Watch in delight as any target in a 20m radius is reduced to shambles.

Edited February 1, 2015 by Captain Kirkbal
